Name: Be-ton
Ingredients: 105 ml Thomas Henry Tonic Water chilled
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
POUR both ingredients into chilled glass.
Review: The delicately spiced Beton is the Czech Republic's answer to the Gin & Tonic and is considered the national drink.
History: First made for the Montreal EXPO exhibition in 1967, the cocktail takes its name "Be-ton" from its two ingredients: Becherovka and tonic water. Beton is also the Czech word for concrete, suggesting it is strong, like concrete.
Nutrition: One serving of Be-ton contains 158 calories
